California Treasurer Bill Lockyer told Reuters Insider Monday that states may not need the same freedom to declare bankruptcy as major companies because they have a guaranteed source of revenue. The major difference, of course, is that we're looking at sovereign governments that have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with, he said. In Israel, where leaders have worried that the turmoil might jeopardize the country's peace treaty with Egypt, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu welcomed reassurance from the military council that it respects all regional and international obligations and treaties. A total of 18 artifacts disappeared from the Egyptian Museum during the demonstrations and riots, including two statues of King Tutankhamun, Zahi Hawass , head of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said on his website.
